result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Return date on November 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Letter to the defendant dated 09/12/2022 re: Court appoints Atty Jeanne Zamzow. Defendant is to pay $200 per month commencing 09/30/2022 for court appointed attorney fees.
Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney (Atty Jeanne Zamzow)

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant Scott J Sommers in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by defendant, requests the Court appoint an attorney. Court questions defendant how much he can pay for counsel. Statement by defendant - can pay $250.00. Court orders defendant to pay $200 per month commencing September 30, 2022 and every month thereafter. Defendant to fill out the form and return it to the COC's office.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant Scott J Sommers in court.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he does not have an attorney, but does have a job so he can get an attorney. Court sets for Status of Counsel on September 6, 2022 at 10:30 AM
Second appearance scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Second appearance on September 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

NOT ON THE RECORD

Second appearance scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Second appearance on July 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant Scott J Sommers in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Def requests more time for an attorney. Court sets for Status of Counsel May 31, 2022 at 10:00 AM.
Second appearance scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Second appearance on May 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

NOT ON THE RECORD  Defendant Scott J Sommers in court.  Attorney Matthew McErloy in court for State of Wisconsin. Def states he is unsure qualifies for the public defender and has not received anything yet from their office. Court sets Status of Counsel April 26, 2022 at 10:00 AM.
Second appearance scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Second appearance on April 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Second appearance on March 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:57 AM Defendant Scott J Sommers appeared in court, Attorney Michael Kapelis appears in court for the defendant, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis states def is eligible for the public defender but is unsure if he will be appointed. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court finds probable cause. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on all counts on behalf of the defendant. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.   Court will set for Status of Counsel for March 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court adjourned at 10:00 AM.
